title: EastEnders spoilers: Wedding drama revealed for Tiffany and Keegan as they get engaged
text:
Tiffany Butcher (Maisie Smith) and Keegan Baker’s (Zack Morris) relationship has been anything but smooth in EastEnders, but — in spite of this — the pair have managed to make a proper go of things and, during tonight’s episode, they decided to take their relationship to the next level. Afterwards, they discussed their future and, after some deliberation, they came to a huge decision.

Tiffany’s had an incredibly tough year, but — with help from her loved ones — she’s been able to move on and, before long, she found herself developing feelings for Keegan. The young lad felt the same way, which led to them beginning a relationship. Due to the strength of said relationship, Tiffany was able to open up to Keegan about her harrowing rape ordeal at the hands of Fraser (Shanu Hazzan).

After much discussion about whether or not she was ready to take their relationship to the next level, tonight’s episode saw Tiffany come to the realisation that she was, in fact, ready.

Tiffany wasn’t keen for such a special experience to take place in the Taylor household for fear of someone walking in on them, but when they got wind that the hotel room Gray (Toby Alexander-Smith) and Chantelle (Jessica Plummer) were due to use had become available, they were quick to make use of the opportunity.

Advertisement

Advertisement

After spending the night together, Keegan told Tiffany that he loved her — feelings which she reciprocated — and they kissed — more happier than ever.

Afterwards, they discussed their future together, and — making reference to the fact that both Gray and Chantelle married young — Keegan came to the realisation that ‘when you know, you know.’ As a result, he got down on one knee and proposed to a shocked Tiffany.

Without wasting any time, Tiff said ‘yes’, and the pair embraced — excited for their future together as man and wife.

The question is: how will their families react to the shock proposal?

Well, if recent images of the cast filming on location are anything to go by, then not very well, as Karen (Lorraine Stanley) will seemingly swoop into action — with her family in tow — in an attempt to stop the wedding from taking place.

EastEnders continues Tuesday 15th October at 7:30pm on BBC One.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: But what will their families say?
